bcbioSingleCell

Plot Principal Component Analysis (PCA)

Plot Principal Component Analysis (PCA)

# S4 method for seurat
plotPCA(object, interestingGroups = "ident",
  pointsAsNumbers = FALSE, pointSize = 0.5, pointAlpha = 0.8,
  label = TRUE, labelSize = 6L, color = ggplot2::scale_color_hue(),
  dark = TRUE, title = NULL)

Arguments

object

Object.
interestingGroups

Interesting group to use for plot colors.
pointsAsNumbers

Plot the points as numbers (TRUE) or dots (FALSE).
pointSize

Cell point size.
pointAlpha

Alpha transparency level. Useful when there many cells in the dataset, and some cells can be masked.
label

Overlay a cluster identitiy label on the plot.
labelSize

Size of the text label.
color

Color palette to use for points. Defaults to the viridis color palette. Use ggplot2::scale_color_gradient() to easily define your own low/high gradient.
dark

Enable dark mode.
title

Plot title.

Value

ggplot.

See also

plotTSNE().

Other PCA Utilities: fetchPCAData

Examples

load(system.file(
    file.path("extdata", "seurat.rda"),
    package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

# seurat
plotPCA(seurat)
